thread.title: Mexico’s 2017 Trade Deficit Narrows

author: Anthony Harrup
title: Mexico’s 2017 Trade Deficit Narrows
text:
MEXICO CITY—Mexico registered its smallest trade deficit in three years as last year’s gains in exports of manufactured goods helped offset a widening gap in its petroleum products trade.
The country ran up a $157 million deficit in December, bringing the full-year 2017 trade deficit to $10.88 billion, the National Statistics Institute said Friday. December exports rose 7.9% to $35.82 billion, and imports rose 8.4% to $35.98 billion.
